model.caldata_ddrc_pipelines.usace__dash.name: usace__dashboard_metrics
model.caldata_ddrc_pipelines.usace__dash.description: Replicating the dashboard metrics from USACE LA Fire website
model.caldata_ddrc_pipelines.usace__dash.raw_code:
with usace as (

    select * from {{ ref('int_usace__most_recent_debris_removal') }}
    where
        event_sub_name in ('Eaton', 'Palisades')
        and ma = '4856DR-CA-COE-SPD-09'

),

roe_status as (
    select
        'phase2_roes_accepted' as metric_name,
        'TK' as metric_unit_label,
        count(distinct object_id) as metric_value,
        last_updated
    from usace
    where
        roe_approved is not null
        and roe_status not in ('returned_ineligible', 'returned_withdrawn')
        and roe_details = 'County'
    group by all
),

in_queue as (
    select
        'phase2_parcels_in_queue' as metric_name,
        'TK' as metric_unit_label,
        count(distinct object_id) as metric_value,
        last_updated
    from usace
    where
        roe_submitted is not null
        and roe_status not in ('returned_ineligible', 'returned_withdrawn')
        and roe_details = 'County'
    group by all

),

-- reinstating this metric per Matt's request 3/20
fso_return as (
    select
        'phase2_parcels_completed' as metric_name,
        'TK' as metric_unit_label,
        count(distinct object_id) as metric_value,
        last_updated
    from usace
    where
        fso_pkg_approved is not null
        and roe_status not in ('returned_ineligible', 'returned_withdrawn')
        and roe_details = 'County'
    group by all
),

usace_dashboard_metrics as (

    select * from roe_status
    union all
    select * from in_queue
    union all
    select * from fso_return

)

select * from usace_dashboard_metrics

model.caldata_ddrc_pipelines.pasadena_pe.name: pasadena_permitting_metrics
model.caldata_ddrc_pipelines.pasadena_pe.description:
Aggregated metrics for Pasadena rebuild permitting activities.
Currently returns placeholder values (0) as the data pipeline
for Pasadena is not yet implemented.

metric_name.name: metric_name
metric_name.description: The name of the specific metric being tracked.

metric_value.name: metric_value
metric_value.description:
The numeric value of the metric (count of applications/permits).
Currently hardcoded to 0 as placeholder until data pipeline is implemented.

last_updated.name: last_updated
last_updated.description:
Timestamp indicating when the metrics were generated.
Currently set to current timestamp since these are placeholder values,
displayed in UTC timezone for consistency.

model.caldata_ddrc_pipelines.pasadena_pe.raw_code:
with pasadena_permitting as (
    select * from {{ ref('int_pasadena__eaton_fire_rebuild_permits') }}
),

pasadena_rebuild_applications_received as (
    select
        'pasadena_rebuild_applications_received' as metric_name,
        count(*) as metric_value
    from pasadena_permitting
),

pasadena_rebuild_applications_in_review as (
    select
        'pasadena_rebuild_applications_in_review' as metric_name,
        count(*) as metric_value
    from pasadena_permitting
    where permit_status in ('In Review')
),

pasadena_building_permits_issued as (
    select
        'pasadena_building_permits_issued' as metric_name,
        count(*) as metric_value
    from pasadena_permitting
    where permit_status in ('Issued')
),

combined as (
    select * from pasadena_rebuild_applications_received
    union all
    select * from pasadena_rebuild_applications_in_review
    union all
    select * from pasadena_building_permits_issued
)

select
    combined.*,
    (select max(p.last_updated) as last_updated from pasadena_permitting as p) as last_updated
from combined

model.caldata_ddrc_pipelines.malibu_perm.name: malibu_permitting_metrics
model.caldata_ddrc_pipelines.malibu_perm.description:
Aggregated metrics for Malibu rebuild permitting activities.
Provides key counts for applications received, in review,
and permits issued for dashboard reporting.

metric_name.name: metric_name
metric_name.description: The name of the specific metric being tracked.

metric_value.name: metric_value
metric_value.description:
The numeric value of the metric (count of applications/permits).
Always represents a count of records.

last_updated.name: last_updated
last_updated.description:
Timestamp indicating when the underlying data was last updated.
Represents the most recent update across all application records,
displayed in UTC timezone for consistency.

model.caldata_ddrc_pipelines.malibu_perm.raw_code:
with applications as (
    select * from {{ ref("int_malibu__applications") }}
),

malibu_rebuild_applications_received as (
    select
        'malibu_rebuild_applications_received' as metric_name,
        count(*) as metric_value
    from applications
),

malibu_rebuild_applications_in_review as (
    select
        'malibu_rebuild_applications_in_review' as metric_name,
        count(*) as metric_value
    from applications
    where type in ('InPlanning', 'InBPC')
),

malibu_building_permits_issued as (
    select
        'malibu_building_permits_issued' as metric_name,
        count(*) as metric_value
    from applications
    where type in ('PermitIssued')
),

-- TODO: what building permits are in the permits issued table?
-- seems to be different from the pplications table.
/*malibu_building_permits_issued as (
    select
        'malibu_building_permits_issued' as metric_name,
        any_value(permits) as metric_value,
        any_value(last_updated) as last_updated
    from {{ ref("int_malibu__permits_issued") }}
    where type = 'Building'
),*/

combined as (
    select * from malibu_rebuild_applications_received
    union all
    select * from malibu_rebuild_applications_in_review
    union all
    select * from malibu_building_permits_issued
)

select
    combined.*,
    (select max(a.last_updated) as last_updated from applications as a) as last_updated
from combined

model.caldata_ddrc_pipelines.public_stat.name: public_status_by_land_use_and_fire_name_counted
model.caldata_ddrc_pipelines.public_stat.description:
This model returns the count of public statuses
by land use and fire name for the most recent
data load date.
model.caldata_ddrc_pipelines.public_stat.raw_code:
with most_recent_psa_data as (
    select * from {{ ref('int_epa__most_recent_public_status_assessment') }}
),

ps_by_land_use_and_fire_name_counted as (

    select
        public_status,
        COUNT(public_status) as public_status_count,
        land_use,
        fire_name,
        last_updated

    from most_recent_psa_data
    group by public_status, land_use, fire_name, last_updated

)

select * from ps_by_land_use_and_fire_name_counted
model.caldata_ddrc_pipelines.public_stat.compiled_code:

    select * from TRANSFORM_DDRC_PRD.epa.int_epa__most_recent_public_status_assessment
),

ps_by_land_use_and_fire_name_counted as (

    select
        public_status,
        COUNT(public_status) as public_status_count,
        land_use,
        fire_name,
        last_updated

    from most_recent_psa_data
    group by public_status, land_use, fire_name, last_updated

)

select * from ps_by_land_use_and_fire_name_counted

model.caldata_ddrc_pipelines.ddrc_metric.name: ddrc_metrics_summary
model.caldata_ddrc_pipelines.ddrc_metric.description: All metrics for the Digital Disaster Recovery Center. Each metric overwrites its previous entry on every update.

metric_unit_label.name: metric_unit_label
metric_unit_label.description: Longer description of what metric measure

update_frequency.name: update_frequency
update_frequency.description: How often this metric is updated

model.caldata_ddrc_pipelines.ddrc_metric.raw_code:
with epa_count_phase1_complete as (
    select
        'cleanup_phase1_complete' as metric_name,
        sum(public_status_count) as metric_value,
        'count' as metric_type,
        'cleanups completed' as metric_unit_label,
        'daily' as update_frequency, --acceptable values for this field are 'As needed', 'Daily', 'Weekly', or 'Monthly'
        max(last_updated) as last_updated
    from {{ ref('public_status_by_land_use_and_fire_name_counted') }}
    where
        public_status in ('Phase 1 Complete', 'Deferred to Phase 2')
        and land_use = 'Residential'
),

usace_parcel_debris_metrics as (
    select
        metric_name,
        metric_value,
        'count' as metric_type,
        metric_unit_label,
        'daily' as update_frequency,
        last_updated
    from {{ ref('usace__dashboard_metrics') }}
),

malibu_permitting_metrics as (
    select
        metric_name,
        metric_value,
        'count' as metric_type,
        'TK' as metric_unit_label,
        'daily' as update_frequency,
        last_updated
    from {{ ref('malibu_permitting_metrics') }}
),

pasadena_permitting_metrics as (
    select
        metric_name,
        metric_value,
        'count' as metric_type,
        'TK' as metric_unit_label,
        'daily' as update_frequency,
        last_updated
    from {{ ref('pasadena_permitting_metrics') }}
),

--As additional automated metrics (as in, metrics that are not
--manually entered into the airtable are added to the DDRC,
--union them together here:
pipeline_metrics as (
    select * from epa_count_phase1_complete
    union all
    select * from usace_parcel_debris_metrics
    union all
    select * from malibu_permitting_metrics
    union all
    select * from pasadena_permitting_metrics
),

--The Airtable captures all metrics, including those
--entered manually, we will use it to add in any of the metrics
--that we do not have automated pipelines for yet:
airtable_metrics as (
    select
        metric_machine_name as metric_name,
        metric as metric_value,
        metric_type,
        metric_unit_label,
        update_frequency,
        last_updated
    from {{ ref('airtable__most_recent_metrics') }}
    where
        metric_name not in (select pm.metric_name from pipeline_metrics as pm) -- this line ensures we are always
        --prioritizing a metric coming from one of our API pipelines, if it also exists in airtable
),

-- Note: deliberately not casting last_updated timestamp_tz in this model.
-- It's enforced by the contract, and if anything *not* a UTC timestamp sneaks in,
-- the union should fail
ddrc_metrics as (
    select * from pipeline_metrics
    union all
    select * from airtable_metrics
)

select
    metric_name,
    to_number(metric_value, 38, 2) as metric_value,
    metric_type,
    metric_unit_label,
    update_frequency,
    last_updated
from ddrc_metrics

model.caldata_ddrc_pipelines.airtable__m.name: airtable__most_recent_metrics
model.caldata_ddrc_pipelines.airtable__m.description:
This model returns the most recently-updated version
of each metric in the Airtable.
model.caldata_ddrc_pipelines.airtable__m.raw_code:
with air as (

    select * from {{ ref('stg_airtable__metrics') }}
    where metric is not null

),

-- select most recent version of each individual metric
max_modified as (
    select
        metric_machine_name,
        to_number(metric, 38, 2) as metric,
        metric_type,
        metric_unit_label,
        lower(update_frequency) as update_frequency,
        date_created,
        max(date_created)
            over (partition by metric_name) as last_updated
    from air
)

select
    metric_machine_name,
    metric,
    metric_type,
    metric_unit_label,
    update_frequency,
    date_created,
    last_updated
from max_modified
where date_created = last_updated
group by all
model.caldata_ddrc_pipelines.airtable__m.compiled_code:
with air as (

    select * from TRANSFORM_DDRC_PRD.airtable.stg_airtable__metrics
    where metric is not null

),

-- select most recent version of each individual metric
max_modified as (
    select
        metric_machine_name,
        to_number(metric, 38, 2) as metric,
        metric_type,
        metric_unit_label,
        lower(update_frequency) as update_frequency,
        date_created,
        max(date_created)
            over (partition by metric_name) as last_updated
    from air
)

select
    metric_machine_name,
    metric,
    metric_type,
    metric_unit_label,
    update_frequency,
    date_created,
    last_updated
from max_modified
where date_created = last_updated
group by all

model.caldata_ddrc_pipelines.int_pasaden.name: int_pasadena__eaton_fire_rebuild_permits
model.caldata_ddrc_pipelines.int_pasaden.description:
Intermediate model for Pasadena Eaton fire rebuild permits.
Filters to the most recent data load and provides clean
permit data for downstream marts.

permit_number.name: permit_number
permit_number.description: Official permit number issued by the city

parcel_number.name: parcel_number
parcel_number.description: Assessor's parcel number for the property

city.name: city
city.description: City where the property is located

state.name: state
state.description: State where the property is located

work_class.name: work_class
work_class.description: Classification of the work type for the permit

description.name: description
description.description: Detailed description of the work to be performed

council_district.name: council_district
council_district.description: City council district where the property is located

last_updated.name: last_updated
last_updated.description:
Date when this record was last edited in the source system.
Used for tracking when permit data was last modified.

model.caldata_ddrc_pipelines.int_pasaden.raw_code:
with rebuild_permits as (
    select * from {{ ref("stg_pasadena__eaton_fire_rebuild_permits") }}
)

select
    permit_number,
    parcel_number,
    address,
    city,
    state,
    zipcode,
    permit_status,
    work_class,
    permit_type,
    description,
    council_district,
    convert_timezone('UTC', last_updated) as last_updated
from rebuild_permits
where _load_date = (select max(r._load_date) from rebuild_permits as r)

model.caldata_ddrc_pipelines.int_malibu_.description:
Intermediate model for Malibu rebuild applications.
Filters to the most recent data load and provides clean
application data for downstream marts.

type.name: type
type.description:
The type/status of the rebuild application.
Used to categorize applications by their current state
in the permitting process.

lat.name: lat
lat.description: Latitude coordinate of the rebuild location

lon.name: lon
lon.description: Longitude coordinate of the rebuild location

project_number.name: project_number
project_number.description:
Unique project identifier for the rebuild application.
Used for tracking individual projects through the system.

planning_approved.name: planning_approved
planning_approved.description:
Boolean flag indicating whether planning approval has been granted.
Used to track approval status in the permitting process.

last_updated.name: last_updated
last_updated.description:
Timestamp indicating when the record was last updated,
displayed in UTC timezone for consistency across all models.

model.caldata_ddrc_pipelines.int_malibu_.raw_code:
with rebuild_points as (
    select * from {{ ref("stg_malibu__fire_rebuild_points") }}
)

select
    type,
    lat,
    lon,
    project_number,
    planning_approved,
    convert_timezone('UTC', last_updated) as last_updated

where _load_date = (select max(r._load_date) from rebuild_points as r)

model.caldata_ddrc_pipelines.stg_airtabl.name: stg_airtable__metrics
model.caldata_ddrc_pipelines.stg_airtabl.description:
This model returns the most recently-updated version
of each metric in the Airtable.
model.caldata_ddrc_pipelines.stg_airtabl.raw_code:
with air as (

    select
        metrics.id,
        metrics._fivetran_synced,
        metrics.datetime_offset_number,
        to_timestamp_tz(metrics.date_created) as date_created,
        metrics.as_of_label,
        metrics.datetime_offset_variable,
        to_timestamp_tz(metrics.date_metric_modified) as date_metric_modified,
        metrics.metric,
        a.value::varchar as metric_type,
        b.value::varchar as as_of_time,
        c.value::varchar as metric_name,
        d.value::varchar as metric_unit_label,
        e.value::varchar as metric_title_for_interface,
        f.value::varchar as metric_machine_name,
        g.value::varchar as topic,
        h.value::varchar as update_frequency

    from {{ source('AIRTABLE','METRICS') }} as metrics,
        lateral flatten(metrics.metric_type_from_metric_definition_) as a,
        lateral flatten(metrics.as_of_time_from_metric_definition_) as b,
        lateral flatten(metrics.metric_name_from_metric_definition_) as c,
        lateral flatten(metrics.metric_unit_label_from_metric_definition_) as d,
        lateral flatten(metrics.metric_title_for_interface) as e,
        lateral flatten(metrics.metric_machine_name_from_metric_definition_) as f,
        lateral flatten(metrics.topic_from_metric_definition_) as g,
        lateral flatten(metrics.update_frequency_from_metric_definition_) as h

)

select * from air

test.caldata_ddrc_pipelines.is_positive_.name: is_positive_or_zero_usace__dashboard_metrics_metric_value__TK__metric_unit_label
test.caldata_ddrc_pipelines.is_positive_.compiled_code:
with validation as (

    select
        metric_unit_label as metric_type,
        metric_value as positive_field

    from ANALYTICS_DDRC_PRD.usace.usace__dashboard_metrics

),

validation_errors as (

    select
        positive_field

    -- if this is true, then positive_field is negative
    where positive_field < 0 and metric_type  = 'TK'

)

from validation_errors

macro.caldata_ddrc_pipelines.test_is_non.name: test_is_non_floating_point
macro.caldata_ddrc_pipelines.test_is_non.macro_sql:
{% test is_non_floating_point(model, column_name, metric_type, metric_target_type) %}

with validation as (

    select
        {{ metric_type }} as metric_type,
        {{ column_name }} as non_floating_point_field

    from {{ model }}

),

validation_errors as (

    select
        non_floating_point_field

    from validation
    -- if this is true, then non_floating_point_field contains decimals

    where MOD(non_floating_point_field,1) <> 0
    and metric_type  = '{{ metric_target_type }}'

)

select *
from validation_errors

{% endtest %}

    from validation
    -- if this is true, amount is not over threshold.
    where amount_field < {{ threshold_amount }} and metric_column_name  = '{{ metric_name }}'

)

select *
from validation_errors

{% endtest %}

macro.caldata_ddrc_pipelines.validate_al.name: validate_all_schemas
macro.caldata_ddrc_pipelines.validate_al.description:
Macro to validate all model and source schemas in the project against
their documentation.

This macro creates a comprehensive report of schema validation issues
across all models and sources in the project. It compares the documented
columns in dbt YAML files with the actual columns in the database
tables/views.

The macro will always raise an error if validation issues are found, making
it suitable for use in CI/CD pipelines to enforce schema documentation
standards.

arguments.name: errors_only
arguments.description:
If true, only shows tables with validation errors. If false, shows all
validation results including successful matches. Defaults to false.

arguments.name: undocumented_columns_as_errors
arguments.description:
If true, treats undocumented columns as validation errors. If false,
undocumented columns are reported as warnings but don't cause failure.
Defaults to true.

macro.caldata_ddrc_pipelines.generate_sc.description:
Macro to retrieve a custom schema name for a model or source.

This macro returns the schema name based on project conventions,
environment, or other logic.
Useful for dynamically assigning schemas in multi-environment dbt projects.

arguments.name: model_name
arguments.description: The name of the model or source for which to get the custom schema.

arguments.name: environment
arguments.description:
The environment (e.g., dev, prod) to use when determining the schema name.
Optional.

macro.caldata_ddrc_pipelines.test_is_pos.name: test_is_positive_or_zero
macro.caldata_ddrc_pipelines.test_is_pos.macro_sql:
{% test is_positive_or_zero(model, column_name, metric_type, metric_target_type) %}

with validation as (

    select
        {{ metric_type }} as metric_type,
        {{ column_name }} as positive_field

    from {{ model }}

),

validation_errors as (

    select
        positive_field

    from validation
    -- if this is true, then positive_field is negative
    where positive_field < 0 and metric_type  = '{{ metric_target_type }}'

)

select *
from validation_errors

{% endtest %}

Macro to drop all schemas in the database with a specified prefix.

it if it exists.
Useful for cleaning up test or temporary schemas in CI/CD workflows.

arguments.name: prefix
arguments.description: The prefix to use when constructing the schema name to drop.

arguments.name: database
arguments.description: The database in which the schema resides. Optional; defaults to the target database.

macro.dbt_snowflake.snowflake__get_catal.name: snowflake__get_catalog
snowflake__get_catalog_relations
snowflake__get_catalog_tables_sql
macro.dbt_snowflake.snowflake__get_catal.macro_sql:
{% macro snowflake__get_catalog_tables_sql(information_schema) -%}
    select
        table_catalog as "table_database",
        table_schema as "table_schema",
        table_name as "table_name",
        case
            when is_dynamic = 'YES' and table_type = 'BASE TABLE' THEN 'DYNAMIC TABLE'
            else table_type
        end as "table_type",
        comment as "table_comment",

        -- note: this is the _role_ that owns the table
        table_owner as "table_owner",

        'Clustering Key' as "stats:clustering_key:label",
        clustering_key as "stats:clustering_key:value",
        'The key used to cluster this table' as "stats:clustering_key:description",
        (clustering_key is not null) as "stats:clustering_key:include",

        'Row Count' as "stats:row_count:label",
        row_count as "stats:row_count:value",
        'An approximate count of rows in this table' as "stats:row_count:description",
        (row_count is not null) as "stats:row_count:include",

        'Approximate Size' as "stats:bytes:label",
        bytes as "stats:bytes:value",
        'Approximate size of the table as reported by Snowflake' as "stats:bytes:description",
        (bytes is not null) as "stats:bytes:include",

        'Last Modified' as "stats:last_modified:label",
        to_varchar(convert_timezone('UTC', last_altered), 'yyyy-mm-dd HH24:MI'||'UTC') as "stats:last_modified:value",
        'The timestamp for last update/change' as "stats:last_modified:description",
        (last_altered is not null and table_type='BASE TABLE') as "stats:last_modified:include"
    from {{ information_schema }}.tables
{%- endmacro %}

macro.dbt_snowflake.snowflake__get_catal.name: snowflake__get_catalog_columns_sql
macro.dbt_snowflake.snowflake__get_catal.macro_sql:
{% macro snowflake__get_catalog_columns_sql(information_schema) -%}
    select
        table_catalog as "table_database",
        table_schema as "table_schema",
        table_name as "table_name",

        column_name as "column_name",
        ordinal_position as "column_index",
        data_type as "column_type",
        comment as "column_comment"
    from {{ information_schema }}.columns
{%- endmacro %}

doc.caldata_ddrc_pipelines.__overview__.name: __overview__
doc.caldata_ddrc_pipelines.__overview__.block_contents:
# CalData Digital Disaster Recovery Center Data Pipelines dbt Documentation

Welcome to CalData Data Operations and Engineering's CalData Digital Disaster Recovery Center Data Pipelines `dbt` docs.
To go back to the top-level docs, follow [this link](../)

## Navigation

You can use the `Project` and `Database` navigation tabs on the left side of the window to explore the models in your project.

### Project Tab

The Project tab mirrors the directory structure of your dbt project.
In this tab, you can see all of the models defined in your dbt project, as well as models imported from dbt packages.

### Database Tab

The Database tab also exposes your models, but in a format that looks more like a database explorer.
This view shows relations (tables and views) grouped into database schemas.
Note that ephemeral models are not shown in this interface, as they do not exist in the database.

## Graph Exploration

You can click the blue icon on the bottom-right corner of the page to view the lineage graph of your models.

On model pages, you'll see the immediate parents and children of the model you're exploring.
By clicking the Expand button at the top-right of this lineage pane,
you'll be able to see all of the models that are used to build, or are built from,
the model you're exploring.

Once expanded, you'll be able to use the `--select` and `--exclude` model selection syntax to filter the models in the graph.
For more information on model selection, check out the [dbt docs](https://docs.getdbt.com/reference/node-selection/syntax).

Note that you can also right-click on models to interactively filter and explore the graph.

doc.dbt.__overview__.block_contents:
### Welcome!

Welcome to the auto-generated documentation for your dbt project!

### Navigation

You can use the `Project` and `Database` navigation tabs on the left side of the window to explore the models
in your project.

#### Project Tab
The `Project` tab mirrors the directory structure of your dbt project. In this tab, you can see all of the
models defined in your dbt project, as well as models imported from dbt packages.

#### Database Tab
The `Database` tab also exposes your models, but in a format that looks more like a database explorer. This view
shows relations (tables and views) grouped into database schemas. Note that ephemeral models are _not_ shown
in this interface, as they do not exist in the database.

### Graph Exploration
You can click the blue icon on the bottom-right corner of the page to view the lineage graph of your models.

On model pages, you'll see the immediate parents and children of the model you're exploring. By clicking the `Expand`
button at the top-right of this lineage pane, you'll be able to see all of the models that are used to build,
or are built from, the model you're exploring.

Once expanded, you'll be able to use the `--select` and `--exclude` model selection syntax to filter the
models in the graph. For more information on model selection, check out the [dbt docs](https://docs.getdbt.com/docs/model-selection-syntax).

Note that you can also right-click on models to interactively filter and explore the graph.
